title: How to Make a Tofurky Pot Pie

steps.headline: Heat the butter or oil in a pot or wok over medium heat.
Cook the potatoes, onions, and garlic for about 8 to 10 minutes.
steps.description: Stir frequently so that they don't stick to the pot.

steps.headline: Add the carrots, creamed corn, peas, tofurky, and seasonings to the pot.
Turn down the heat to a medium-low and cook for an additional 5 minutes.
Carefully pour in the milk.
steps.description: Stir and cook for another 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Prepare the bottom pie crust into a pie tray.
steps.description: Use a ladle to scoop the mixture and smooth it out on the crust.

steps.headline: Layer the top crust on top of the mixture.
steps.description: Carefully seal it to the bottom crust.

steps.headline: Use a knife and cut two slits in the middle of the top crust.
steps.description: Bake at 375 °F (191 °C) for 45 minutes on a cookie sheet.

text: Heat the butter or oil in a pot or wok over medium heat.  Cook the potatoes, onions, and garlic for about 8 to 10 minutes. Stir frequently so that they don't stick to the pot. Add the carrots, creamed corn, peas, tofurky, and seasonings to the pot.  Turn down the heat to a medium-low and cook for an additional 5 minutes.  Carefully pour in the milk. Stir and cook for another 5 minutes. Prepare the bottom pie crust into a pie tray. Use a ladle to scoop the mixture and smooth it out on the crust. Layer the top crust on top of the mixture. Carefully seal it to the bottom crust. Use a knife and cut two slits in the middle of the top crust. Bake at 375 °F (191 °C) for 45 minutes on a cookie sheet. Finished.
